item.title: Report E-2024010001
item.description:
Report E-2024010001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 22, 2023, one (!) 55-gallon drum of UN1133 was damaged in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lonestar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized granular absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the UN1133-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120645
item.description:
Report X-2023120645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was improperly loaded with the arrows not facing upwards. Poor handling led to loose closures leaking. At discovery, area was cleared of employees and the hazmat was securely placed in a hazardous material bucket to await processing. DescribePack: loose caps on all 4 bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The area was cleaned with absorbent mats. Package handlers were trained on what to do with a hazardous damage.

item.title: Report E-2024010007
item.description:
Report E-2024010007

  • City: Mansfield

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank when the connection between the hose and storage tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 45 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Lonestar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023120644
item.description:
Report X-2023120644

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The loose cap led to the leakage. Improper handling allowed to occur. The package was not loaded correctly with the arrows upwards. At discovery, the hazmat was removed from the area and put into a secured hazardous material bucket and awaited processing. DescribePack: Loose caps failed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area of spill was properly cleaned with absorbent mats. Package handlers were given safety tips and continued training on proper loading.

item.title: Report X-2024010032
item.description:
Report X-2024010032

  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN PACKAGE CAR ON RED BELT. RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND PROCEEDED WITH SPILL CART. FOLLOWING APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL THEN TOOK DAMAGED PACKAGE TO DMP TABLE FOR FUTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024010022
item.description:
Report E-2024010022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, at 1945 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of a total of (2) quarts of SHIELD-BRITE ® VACATE (UN1719 Caustic Alkali Liquids, n.o.s. (Sodium Hydroxide, Potassium Hydroxide) 8, II) from (6) 5-gallon plastic pails. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by defective seals in the caps on top of the pails and contained to a 5’ x 6’ area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to neutralize the release and clean it with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and recovered product was placed in (2) 55-gallon DF's and then taken offsite by contractors.

Completed DPR and placed inside yellow tub. DescribePack: Plastic pale cracked at the base and sidewall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents were contained with hazardous bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120725
item.description:
Report X-2023120725

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was called over to clean up a hazmat spill on load side C121 around 9:00 am on Dec. 12, 23. Cleaned up spill with 2 bags of dry oil and scooped it up and placed inside plastic bag. DescribePack: When inspecting package I saw the bottle has a crack on the bottom base corner the length of razor blade. The crack has submerged inside bottle and that is how all the liquid contents leaked out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: I wasn't able to stop the leakage because all the contents leaked out on the floor but I did place all cleanup residue in a plastic bag.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was going down the IC belt in the unload until it got pushed off by another package. When it fell on the floor, it started to leak. Hazmat was called to come clean up the spill and take the damage package to be process. DescribePack: The package only had one jerrican with a cap that wasn't completely closed tight. All the remaining jerrican are still in good condition. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a bag and absorbent was spread at the spilled area.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Item was found on trailer 806716 from 774, unprocessed, sitting on tail end of trailer. When jug was picked up, liquid began pouring out an approx. 1/4" hole, punctured in the upper right corner of jug. Cause of the puncture is unknown. DescribePack: Jug had an approx. 1/4" hole in the upper right corner of jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Jug was immediately placed in a Hazmat recovery bucket lined with plastic bag and absorbent pads on the bottom.

item.title: Report X-2023120793
item.description:
Report X-2023120793

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING COCONUT WATER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. OUTER BOXES HAVE KEEP FROZEN STICKERS APPLIED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER 1Z8085EA0291213084. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 8085EA, TCS, 1311 WEST 2ND STREET, TAYLOR TX 76574-2434.

item.title: Report X-2023120839
item.description:
Report X-2023120839

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was put into trailer with the arrows pointed down when it was being loaded. Two of the four were leaking outside of the box into the trailer causing it to smell, fan was turned on people were moved away. package was moved to the hazmat cage. It leaked because the glass bottles in the box were up side down along with the caps that were not all the way tight. DescribePack: the caps were not tight and was put upside down. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fans were turned on, bay doors open and package was moved to the hazmat cage away from package handlers.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: around 730am QA was called for a hazmat spill that the package was loaded in the middle of the trailer number 808296 causing to leaked out DescribePack: during inspection one of the glass bottle had broke DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: following the sds and using proper wear place in hazmat area for investigation

item.title: Report X-2023120898
item.description:
Report X-2023120898

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 4:56 am at door 10 in the unload PH called out to management that there was a leaking hazmat package. Manager addressed the issue quickly by grabbing gloves, apron and hazmat spill bin. Grabbed 3 hazmat package out the back of trailer #836334 from FTWO that were affected by the one leaking hazmat. Took the bin over to QA to separate corrosive spill from explosive hazmat. DescribePack: Hazmat package failure was a corrosive package that was laid inappropriately on his side instead up right by the orientation arrows. Another identical hazmat package was also inappropriately laid on its side on top of the leaking hazmat. Bottom hazmat was crushed by the pressure and had a failed lid closure due to weight and being laid inappropriately and unsafely in back of the trailer. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in hazmat bin immediately upon discovery. Loose lid was also tightened.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the trailer and had leaked and damaged the exterior packaging it was shipped in. Package was placed into a liquid spill bucket and brought over to QA staging area. DescribePack: Package was in a FedEx repack box and not repackaged in the proper shipping packaging that was needed. Which caused it to spill within the package and damaged the package it was repacked in. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Liquid spill tote with liner.
